title: Strictly's Catherine Tyldesley talks journey on show with Johannes
text:
Catherine Tyldsley was eliminated from Strictly Come Dancing (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing’s Catherine Tyldesley has shared an emotional message with her fans after being voted out of the competition by the judges.

The Coronation Street actress, who was kicked off the show alongside her partner Johannes Radebe after competing against Mike Bushell and Katya Jones in the dance-off, revealed she struggled with low confidence as she began her journey on the series.

Catherine thanked Johannes for helping her combat her issues and admitted that he taught her invaluable lessons – including how to walk in heels.

As she posted a bittersweet picture of herself with her dance partner on Instagram, Catherine wrote: ‘My husband @tompitfield7 took this picture when we had a good cry afterwards. Tears of joy and appreciation for each other. I love this man so much.’

She continued: ‘WHAT a journey!! Thank you all for your messages, your love and support. Thank you BBC for this opportunity.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘When I started my #Strictly journey my confidence was low. My belief in what I could achieve on the show was extremely low.

‘The expectations on my humble body – beyond low.

‘What @johannesradebe gave me was priceless: confidence, belief, love and laughter beyond words!

‘This man is a gift to the world. If there were more people like him the world would be spectacular (with shed loads of #sass!)’

Catherine added: ‘He taught me how to walk in high heels, he taught me how to “own it”… he taught me to love and appreciate what my body could achieve.

Catherine and Johannes were up against Mike and Katya (Picture: BBC)

‘I’m often low on body confidence – but I’m so proud of the limits that I’ve thoroughly pushed on this wonderful journey.

‘I did it for me. I also did it for the hundreds of mums out there who felt they’d lost a little bit of themselves, the women out there who’d become negative about their body.

‘The women who found it hard to look in the mirror and love what they saw.

‘I’m proud of my body and my mind for getting me through this wonderful but incredibly tough experience.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Push your limits ladies and be grateful for everything you’re wonderful body can achieve. “Dance like NOBODY is watching”.’

Strictly fans are up in arms about tonight’s elimination result and claim the wrong person went home.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.

description: Strictly Come Dancing's Catherine Tyldesley shares bittersweet photo as she details journey on the show following shock elimination.
